org_midgardproject_projectsite_document.title: Technical details
org_midgardproject_projectsite_document.content: <div><p>Midgard Create builds on the idea of <a href="http://bergie.iki.fi/blog/decoupling_content_management/">Decoupled Content Management</a>. This means that Midgard Create can be deployed on any web publishing platform that supports some common interfaces like RDFa-annotated content and JSON message passing.</p><h3>Reference architecture</h3><p>The default deployment architecture of Midgard Create is built on a robust basis of web system components to keep the codebase clean, maintainable and simple. The reference architecture of Midgard Create is the following:<br /></p></div><div><ul><li><b>Content Repository</b>: <a href="/midgard2/">Midgard2</a> is used for all persistent content storage and retrieval</li><li><b>Web framework</b>: <a href="/midgardmvc/">Midgard MVC</a> provides a model-view-controller framework for PHP</li><li><b>Server-side scripting language</b>: <a href="http://php.net/">PHP5</a> is used for building the server-side functionality</li><li><b>Client-side scripting language</b>: JavaScript with the <a href="http://jquery.com/">jQuery</a> library is used for client-side scripting</li><li><b>User interface</b>: the <a href="http://jqueryui.com/">jQuery UI</a> library is used for rendering the Midgard Create user interfaces</li><li><b>Rich text editor</b>: <a href="http://aloha-editor.org/">Aloha Editor</a> is used for content editing</li><li><b>Workflow system</b>: <a href="http://incubator.apache.org/zetacomponents/documentation/trunk/Workflow/tutorial.html">Zeta Components Workflow</a> is used for server-side workflow definitions</li></ul></div>
